thread.title: The world is collectively in love with these biracial baby twins
thread.title_full: The world is collectively in love with these biracial baby twins

author: Stephanie Hallett
title: The world is collectively in love with these biracial baby twins
text:
The world is collectively in love with these biracial baby twins All babies are special, but these tiny cuties are a little… extra special. Biracial baby twins Kalani and Jarani Dean were born to a Caucasian mother, Whitney Meyer, and African American father, Tomas Dean, about nine months ago. Unlike most children of interracial couples, however, one of the fraternal twins — Kalani — was born with a white complexion, while Jarani was born with darker skin.
“When Kalani came out I thought she [had albinism] because she was all white. I asked my doctors, but they said, ‘Nope! And I kept thinking she would get color but she didn’t,” said Meyer in an interview today with Us Weekly . “It’s unusual.”
& Like/share us please!! We're chromosome twins . Kalani(on left) is light with blue eyes and Jarani(on right) is the darker one with brown eyes. This is rare but so awesome to share!! How many likes can we get?
Nai-post ni Whitney Meyer noong  Miyerkules, Nobyembre 2, 2016 Estimates of how often this phenomenon occurs vary widely, with some estimates as low as 1 in 500 and others as high as 1 in a million . But regardless of how many other pairs like them are born, the Dean twins definitely win the award for “most viral.”
& Local Quincy Il Biracial Twins!! One is white and one is mix! Really odd and neat!! Just wanted to share with our community!!!
Nai-post ni Whitney Meyer noong  Lunes, Enero 23, 2017 
On Facebook, a post shared by Meyer has garnered more than 2,300 likes, and Meyer has been interviewed by everyone from Us to People to her local ABC station .
Her babies, says Meyer, are proof of “why racism shouldn’t exist.”
“They are different colors, but sisters by blood,” she told People . “One is light and one is mixed, but we love them the same.” The twins were a huge blessing for Meyer and her partner, who lost their 2-year-old son Pravyn about two years ago in a terrible drowning incident. (Meyer also has an older son, Talan, from a previous relationship who she says is a wonderful big brother.)
“It’s heartwarming, the response I’ve gotten to my biracial twins,” she said. “It restores my faith in humanity, at a time when I, when this country, really needs it.”
We’re rooting for your family, Whitney and Tomas!
